newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Cisco, Intel higher.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Cisco, Intel higher.

text.p: Cisco Systems Inc and Intel Corp rose in after hours trading after getting battered during regular hours on Nasdaq, traders said.
Technology stocks were hit hard during regular trading, forcing the Nasdaq composite index down 25 points for the tenth largest one-day point drop.
Cisco Systems Inc gained 7/8 to 68-7/8 in after-hours trade after losing 4-1/8 during regular hours on Nasdaq, traders said.
Intel Corp was trading at 157-3/4, up from a close of 157-1/4 on the Nasdaq. It lost 7-1/2 points during regular trading.
Microsoft Corp, which lost 4-3/4 during regular trading, was trading at 98-1/8 after hours, down from 98-3/8 at the closing bell.
"The market really swung pretty sharply in the last hour of (regular) trading," one trader said. "It's just following through from where it closed."
Technology stocks lost ground during the day as investors reacted to fears of slowing growth at Cisco and a downgrade of Intel.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 193,600 shares, compared to Tuesday's 57,800. Session two volume was 2,839,505, while the volume on Tuesday was 14,624,776.
